text: Junxattus is a genus of spiders in the family Salticidae with a single described species, Junxattus daiqini, . It is native to Sumatra. ==Taxonomy== The genus Junxattus was first published in 2012 by Jerzy Prószyński and Christa L. Deeleman-Reinhold, with the single species Junxattus daiqini. In 2015, Junxia Zhang and Wayne Maddison rejected the genus, placing the species in Laufeia. The genus was re-validated by Prószyński in 2019, and it is accepted by the World Spider Catalog . Prószyński and Deeleman-Reinhold placed the genus in the subfamily Euophryinae, equivalent to the tribe Euophryini in Maddison's 2015 classification of the family Salticidae. ==References== Category:Salticidae Category:Salticidae genera Category:Spiders of Indonesia
title: Junxattus
